pages.text: Shankouclava is a tunicate known from the Maotianshan Shales of China. It is the oldest accepted member of this group, dating to 518 million years ago. It had a soft sack-like body with inner organs also preserved.  They usually had body lengths of 2cm to 4cm in height. Some authors classify it as a stem-tunicate instead, due to morphological reasons.
